intro: Luma canelonensis, commonly known as the golden glory or the Brazilian glory, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It has palmately lobed leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Luma canelonensis thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight.
